info.description: The Shopping Cart Management interface is a set of REST resources that supports the creation of a shopping cart. The interface helps the customer browse the product offerings.
info.title: CPI Shopping Cart Management REST Interface

license.name: Copyright (c) 2016 Telefonaktiebolaget LM Ericsson, Sweden. All rights reserved.

tags.name: Shopping Cart
tags.description: CPI supports authorization and permissions for shopping cart service operations. Thus, user can perform service operations based on a specific authorization and permission set to on the user role. Service operations are performed based on the following authorization model.

post.description: This operation creates a shopping cart.

get.description: This operation reads a Shopping Cart based on an ID.

put.description: This operation completely updates a Shopping Cart.

patch.description: This operation partially updates a Shopping Cart.

delete.description: This operation deletes a shopping cart.

get.description: This operation reads a Shopping Cart Item based on an ID.

parameters.name: itemId
parameters.description: ID of a Shopping Cart Item

post.description: This task cancels the shopping cart by triggering the Cancel Manage Shopping Cart BI task using Orchestration Service.
This task validates the shopping cart and triggers the Finalize Manage Shopping Cart Business Interaction task in Orchestration Service.

This task triggers the Load Installed Base from an external system when customer information is owned by an external system. By loading the installed base, all the information regarding a customer such as contracts, products, services, and resources associated to a customer can be found. This is done by triggering the Manage Shopping Cart Business Interaction Load Installed Base task in Orchestration Service.

This task gets the shopping cart items prices based on its contents. This is done by triggering the Price task from Manage Shopping Cart Business Interaction in Orchestration Service. In case the cart is modified after pricing, this task will be performed again to update the prices.
This task has been created as a placeholder for SI customization to implement. Out-of-the-box behavior is just to return the shopping cart without any effects.

This operation validates the contents of the shopping cart based on the catalog validation rules. This is done by triggering the Validate task for Manage Shopping Cart Business Interaction in Orchestration Service. In case the shopping cart has the installed base, for existing customers, the validation considers the installed base compatibility and the context with the newly added items. interactionPhase determines the level of validation to be triggered. This task can be performed multiple times.
